title: Liberal Arts Social Education Design Utilizing Mobile Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage and general understanding of social phenomena
context.additional_context: Provides social science education using mobile technology for general citizens aged 40+, where learners access microlearning content via personal devices. Learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze ≥2 social phenomena (e.g., population migration, consumption pattern changes) occurring in local communities using mobile apps (Google Trends, social media analytics tools, etc.), and write an interpretive report of ≥500 characters with data visualizations (graphs/charts).
Learners can share project planning and execution processes with peers using mobile-based collaboration tools.
By the end of the 4-week course, learners can complete a project evaluating the impact of science, technology, and environmental issues on daily life.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
